name: Jack Crane

education.shortDegree: BS in Computer Science & Mechanical Engineering
education.degree: Bachelor of Science in Computer Science & Mechanical Engineering

projects.title: Apollos
projects.description: I co-op'd at Differential on the Apollos team, developing mobile apps for megachurches. As part of the Frontend team, I played a key role in constructing our React Native template. Over the process of 31 merged PRs, I drove a feature that secured 3 clients, contributing to over $100k in revenue.
bullets: One of 3 frontend React Native developers, but branched into fullstack
31 merged Pull Requests over summer
Built out a feature that earned Apollos 3 new clients, resulting in $100k+ revenue

projects.title: Multi-Tenant Distributable E-Commerce Platform
projects.description: Built a multi-tenant e-commerce platform that Crane Consumables could sell to their customers, who would put their branding on it and offer it as an online store to their customers. Crane Consumables would handle fulfillment and store management.
bullets: Designed and built a multi-tenant platform including scoped accounts and permissions
Secured a security-critical application using e2e and at-rest encryption
Integrated with Stripe

projects.title: Paddlefest App
projects.description: Developed a React Native mobile app, alongside Express and MySQL data modeling. The app was adopted by ~30% of participants, offering features like a live attraction map, photo sharing, and real-time safety notifications.
bullets: Built a React Native app for with a 30% participant adoption rate
Seamlessly delivered real-time updates to participants
Recieved overwhelmingly positive feedback from users

projects.title: Volunteer Management System
projects.description: Deployed a Next.js web app with an Express and MySQL backend, enabling 150+ volunteers to register seamlessly. The Paddlefest VMS empowered leadership to manage volunteers pre-event and on-site, enhancing existing management processes.
bullets: Served for 4 months with 9 minutes of downtime (99.99% uptime)
Serviced 157 volunteers who signed up for 246 total shifts
Saved Paddlefest leadership hours of work and hundreds of dollars by automating and customizing.

projects.title: Volunteer Coordinator
projects.description: Served as volunteer coordinator, managing over 160 volunteers each year, providing information, serving as a liason between volunteers and leadership, and ensuring that our guests & volunteers had a great experience.
bullets: Recruited, trained, and managed 157 volunteers
Participated in the 6 member executive team, directing the event and ultimately raising $135,000 for Adventure Crew
Directed volunteers through 246 shifts

projects.title: SLUCAM - Research Adjacent
projects.description: At the Saint Louis University Center for Additive Manufacturing, I am working to build out our understanding of Resin printing while learning about engineering for additive manufacturing, performing engineering analysis on models, and pre- and post- processing 3d prints to the highest quality for research labs in the university or other clients.
bullets: Spearheaded our initiative to better understand and optimize our Resin 3d printing processes
Created a custom 3d print dashboard to monitor and control our quality as we refined our processes
Built a custom timelapse PCB to record high-quality videos

projects.title: Teacher's Assistant
projects.description: I am working with the SLU Mechanical Engineering department to help teach the "ESCI 1701" Engineering Fundamentals Studio course, teaching students an introduction to engineering design through an introduction to Solidworks and technical drawing.
bullets: Taught students the basics of understanding Engineering design by directing them through a series of projects to help them understand "design intent".
Gave students their first taste in Solidworks and technical drawing, helping them begin thinking in 3d.

projects.title: MTS Xpress
projects.description: Developed a proof-of-concept app and the corresponding backend and database for internal use by Myers sales reps to quickly order consumable hardware. In tests, MTS Express improved efficiency by reducing lag time between a stock outage and a replacement order being placed. The idea has led to $300k+ in new revenue and has increased the value of orders
bullets: Rapid-prototyped an app to help pitch the idea to leadership
Led to $325,000 in new revenue from Xpress orders
Increased average line item count by 400% and average order value by 160%
Led to a 60% voluntary adoption rate among sales reps
Reduced lag time between a stock outage and a replacement order being placed

projects.title: Sales Reps reporting system
projects.description: Built a full-stack web app for internal use by Myers sales reps to view sales data. This app filled a gap in resources available to reps and allowed them to more easily analyze their data and performance. Featuring auth, role-based access control, high-performance data tables (with conditional formatting), and admin tools.
bullets: Built a React/Express/MySQL app for Myers sales reps to view their sales data
Earned a 70% voluntary rep adoption rate
Provides an average time on page of 44 seconds, meaning users are able to quickly find the information they need

projects.title: Camp Teacher
projects.description: Taught camps to students ages K-12 focused around STEM, including Robotics, Scratch & Python programming, Chemistry, and Physics. Over six years, I taught over 35 weeks of camp, teaching an estimated 700 students. I was awarded the Presidential Volunteer Service Award five times because of my volunteer work at iSPACE.
bullets: Taught over 35 weeks of camp, teaching an estimated 700 students
Awarded the Presidential Volunteer Service Award five times because of my volunteer work at iSPACE
Taught classes in chemistry, physics, robotics, web development, Python, and Scratch focused camps.

projects.title: Kids ski instructor
projects.description: Taught ski lessons for kids ages 5-12. This job refined my teaching skills over my experience of taking over 300 kids who have never been on the snow before to their first chairlift ride and farther. I learned invaluable leadership and education skills while teaching kids my passion.
bullets: Taught ski lessons for kids ages 5-12
Took over 300 kids who have never been on the snow before to their first chairlift ride and farther
Learned invaluable leadership and education skills while teaching kids my passion

projects.title: Sales Loop
projects.description: Building a platform to help distributors and manufacturers sell more products by increasing the efficiency of their sales reps without redesigning existing procedures. Involved creating a React Native app, a Next.js admin panel, and a sturdy backend. React Native (Expo), Node.js, MySQL (Prisma), Cloudflare.
bullets: Built a full React Native barcode scanner app
Built a powerful admin panel for company admins to manage their sales reps and monitor performance
Designed a robust backend to handle the complex data structures and relationships

projects.title: OG Image Generator
projects.description: This open source project with over 100,000 monthy hits dynamically generates social media preview images for over 6,000 different websites. Node.js, MongoDB, Cloudflare.
bullets: 100,000+ monthly hits, generating images for 6,000+ websites
Built on Node.js, React, MySQL, and Cloudflare

projects.title: Apple Music Presence
projects.description: This project integrates with Apple Music and Discord on Macs, allowing users to share the music they are listening to. This project has 79 GitHub stars and roughly 200 new users per month. JS, S3, Node.js.
bullets: 79 GitHub stars, 4 forks, and roughly 200 new users per month
Built on Node.js and S3
Over 400,000 listens registered

projects.title: Ohio River Way
projects.description: The Ohio River Way approached me to build a mobile app for paddlers to use as they experience the outdoors on the Ohio River. The result is a very simple app that links to important resources for paddlers, including river conditions, weather, and safety information. React Native (Expo), Node.js, MySQL (Prisma), Cloudflare.
bullets: Built on React Native (Expo), Node.js, MySQL (Prisma), Cloudflare
Developed an app wholely driven by the client's needs
Safety and legal widgets forced a high expectation of quality
Included location-based experiences

projects.title: DigitalOcean Controller
projects.description: Although never released, this mobile app allows DigitalOcean customers to control their accounts. This project caught the attention of DigitalOcean and I got to meet some of their engineers. React Native (Expo), Cloudflare Functions.
bullets: Caught the attention of DigitalOcean and I got to meet some of their engineers
Built on React Native (Expo), Cloudflare Functions, and DigitalOcean's API

projects.title: OneWheel
projects.description: This project, my first individual exploration into mechanical engineering, is a clone of a OneWheel self-balancing skateboard. This project is still in progress and is 100% originally designed. OnShape, Arduino.
bullets: 100% originally designed, manufactured, and programmed
Built on OnShape and Arduino

projects.title: FIRST Robotics
projects.description: Through over a decade, I have been involved in FIRST robotics, allowing me to participate in the world championship and to captain my high school team to the state championship 3 times, winning awards for teamwork, sportsmanship, documentation, software, and hardware design, as well as I earned the highest individual leadership award in the state.
bullets: Founded and captained a team that competed in the state championship 3 of 4 times
Participated in the world championship.
Earned the highest individual leadership award in the state
Won awards for teamwork, sportsmanship, documentation, software, and hardware design

awards: Summit Country Day Excellence in Technology Award
